events.message: The candidate submitted their application for the software engineer position, highlighting their experience with cloud technologies and backend development.
The recruitment team reviewed the application and categorized it under Engineering due to the candidate's software development background and technical skills.
A recruiter specializing in engineering roles was assigned to manage the candidate's recruiting process and coordinate next steps.
The recruiter conducted a phone screening to assess the candidate’s basic technical knowledge and motivation for the software engineer role.
The candidate responded promptly, expressing enthusiasm about progressing further and confirming their availability for interviews.
The technical interview was scheduled for the candidate with the engineering team to evaluate coding skills and problem-solving capabilities.
The candidate completed the technical interview successfully, demonstrating strong knowledge in software architecture and development best practices.
The HR interview was scheduled to discuss the candidate’s cultural fit and employment terms following the successful technical round.
The HR interview concluded positively; the candidate showed alignment with company values and expressed a strong interest in the role.
An official job offer was proposed, including compensation details and benefits, to the candidate for the software engineer position.
The candidate provided positive feedback about the offer and engaged in discussions to clarify contract terms and start date.
The candidate formally accepted the offer and agreed to join the company as a software engineer, confirming the agreed start date.
The onboarding process began, with the candidate attending orientation sessions and setting up necessary tools for their engineering role.
The hiring process was completed successfully and the candidate has officially joined the engineering team, marking a positive outcome.
